result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A. Stockheimer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/ Minor Pass. < 16 yrs.) [Modifiers: With a Minor Child in the Vehicle], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Modifying to indicate offense is an Unclassified Felony.
Letter to defendant, Court will not approve exemption request without reason with enclosed forms.

11:34 AM. No appearance by Defendant.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Discussion regarding invalid sentence/letter from DOC.  DOJ states we cannot sentence the Defendant to a longer sentence than what he was informed was the maximum. Court finds that based on information from the Attorney General's Office, because the Defendant did not have notice of  the potential penalties, the Court cannot impose those penalites. Court does not order additional jail time in this matter.
Order to show cause hearing on January 14, 2019 at 11:30 am.

11:19 a.m.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court.  Crystal Leigh Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No appearance by defendant.  Statement made by ADA Jensen as to letter from Dept of Corrections as to sentence.  State believes that defendant has received notice of today's hearing and unsure of how defendant is directed to appear.  Attorney Rivard responds to statement of ADA Jensen.  Court directs State to either file an Order to Show Cause or a Probation Review hearing.  Attorney Rivard indicates an Order to Show Cause is his understanding of procedure.  Court encourages parties to look into electronic monitoring for the jail time.  Attorney Rivard was public defender appointed and defendant will need to apply for this.
Spoke with defendant, no idea about new court date.  Resent the Notice of Hearing and letter dated 08-10-18 to defendant, verified address.

2:15 pm.  Defendant Jacob A. Stockheimer in court with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Jacob A. Stockheimer in custody.  Angela Beranek  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No corrections or additions to PSI.
State's recommendation:   Impose and Stay 2 Years Prison , 2 Years E.S.    3 Years Probation:  $ 1200.00 Fine, 120 days jail w/ huber,  76 days credit,  4 year DL Revocation, 12 Month IID,  AODA, Progamming per agent,  Not to drive w/o a valid DL.

Sentence w/held 3 Years Probation
$1200..00 Fine + Court Costs
120 Days Jail w/ huber - 76 Days jail credit.  Any credit for being a Porter will be retroactive .

12 Mo IID  1/2 price order
AODA

Sentencing hearing on May 25, 2018 at 02:15 pm.

Case called at 8:31 am. Defendant Jacob A. Stockheimer in court with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pre-Trial Motions: 1). State MIL: Defense does not have any objections-MIL is granted by the Court.  2). Witness List: Defense will only potentially call the defendant. 3). If defendant is called to testify: State notes 3 prior convictions, Defense disagrees and indicates there should be no prior convictions. Court rules that the defendant will indicate 2 prior convictions.  4). Elements of Count 1 and Count 2 re: Defendant's DL being revoked.  5). Defendant stipulates to prior convictions/State will not need to prove them.  6). Operating without  DL insurance citation that is riding along to be addressed later. Court will call 20 jurors with 4 strikes for each side.  Exhibits wont go back to jury room unless stipulated upon/absolutely necessary.
State's Motion to Impeach Defendant with Prior Convictions
Pre-trial conference on March 20, 2018 at 08:30 am.
